## Gyros

![](gyros/gyros.jpeg){width="300"}

### Ingredients

#### Meat
- $8$ pieces pita
- $2.5 - 3$ lbs chicken breast, cubed

####  Marinade
- $1$ tbsp dried oregano
- $1$ tbsp paprika
- $2$ tsp black pepper
- $1$ tbsp salt
- $1$ tbsp rosemary, finely chopped
- $5$ cloves chopped garlic
- $2$ tbsp vegetable oil

####  Tzatziki Sauce
- $2$ cups full-fat, plain greek yogurt (make sure it's plain, not vanilla)
- $\frac{1}{2}$ cucumber, grated (the other half will be used as a topping)
- $\frac{1}{4}$ cup chopped parsley
- salt and pepper to taste
- $3$ cloves of finely chopped garlic
- $2$ tbsp olive oil

#### Toppings
- $1$ red onion, sliced thinly
- $\frac{1}{2}$ cucumber, chopped (the other half will be used in the sauce)
- $2$ roma tomatoes, diced
- $1$ container pitted kalamata olives
- $1$ container feta cheese



### Directions

1.  In a large bowl, combine marinade ingredients until a paste is formed
1.  Add cubed chicken to marinade (note:  marination for any longer than $30$ minutes isn't necessary)
1.  In a stainless steel pan, cook chicken until it reaches an internal temperature of $155 \degree F$
1.  While the chicken cooks, combine the tzatziki sauce ingredients in a large bowl and stir to combine
1.  Assemble by warming pita in the microwave, adding chicken and toppings, and finishing wiht tzatziki sauce on top
